location: England, London, St. Dunstan's Hill, Lower Thames Street
description: A site excavated in 1967, it was described as a small 'temple-like' building, it formed a single room with an eastern facing entrance and evidence for red and pink painted walls.
bibliography: Schofield, J., Guildhall museum archive guide - draft
Shepherd, J., Hall, J., (2008), Places of worship in Roman London and beyond, in Ritual Landscapes of Roman South-East Britain
Perring, D., Brigham, T., (2000), Londinium and its Hinterland: The Roman Period, The archaeology of Greater London, pg. 135
